The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that enclose its seeds, which are often covered in a sticky, gelatinous coating. Sarcotheca monophylla is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it has adapted to survive with minimal water. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
